posts.author: MrZork
posts.content:
Product page on Beamdog: https://www.beamdog.com/products/neverw ... tal-deluxe

posts.author: MrZork
posts.content:
BTW, I think this will generally be a good thing. It will bring lots of people into the game and back to the game. Many people have trouble getting NWN to run on newer OSes and with recent hardware. Beamdog's version will, at the very least, run pretty much out-of-the-box, without tweaking compatibility and "run as administrator"-type settings.

Moreover, having followed some of the Beamdog discussion and watched a couple of their NWN:EE podcasts, they are dedicated to preserving compatibility with community content. That is, most modules that run on NWN 1.69 will run as-is on NWN:EE. There are one or two things where that can't happen. (Apparently there are licensing issues with some media formats, so those may not play in community modules without conversion. BD's approach seems to be to go with non-proprietary formats, so that this issue doesn't come up again.)

Beamdog has been fixing things that are broken. The Master Server will be (and apparently is already) back. They have been working with people in the NWN fan community (Shadooow who does the CPP 1.7x project, people from NWNx, AD from CEP 2.6x, etc.) and have been soliciting input. And, they have already fixed many known NWN issues (there is a list somewhere).

But, best of all IMO, with regard to fixes, the Beamdog approach has been: If it's actually broken or acting bizarrely, then we fix it; but, the emphasis is on de-hard-coding things that are hard-coded so that the community can address things that are really preferences. To me, that is the best approach. People who like NWN mostly as-is will get that. People who have been hankering for bigger changes like 3.5-style feats and classes will see that since the community will be able to code those. They are even talking about (not promising yet) things like pre-loading HAKs and so on so that new base classes are available at character creation.

Anyway, all of that is good news, IMO.

Perhaps less good is that, as has been the case in the past when new patches were released from Bioware, the client and server will have to be the same version. So, PWs that want to serve players with the new client will have to convert. A handful or two PWs are already running beta versions with NWN:EE (BD has made the pre-release version available to pre-order customers). That will cause some grumbling as people complain that the version of 1.69 that they bought from GOG for $5.99 is no longer supported by this or that PW. To me, spending another $20 on NWN is an easy call, given how much enjoyment I get from the game.

BTW, the podcasts have been pretty interesting and (IMO) re-assuring for those worried about what Beamdog is planning for our beloved NWN. Trent Oster was one of the Bioware people who worked on NWN back in the day and he clearly really gets the game and why it's awesome. I am pretty excited about this.

posts.content: Thanks.  I stopped playing the game after my last laptop purchase - tired of jumping through hoops to get it to run.  I will likely come back to NWN:EE.  I've joined the Steam forum about it.

any thoughts now that its been running for a while? For the common player, they spent $20 for effectivly what they had before.

I get that beamdogworked hard on it... the release and advertisement just seemed misleading... Had they advertised it as an update to the backend and for all you players out there.... THE SERVER LIST IS FIXED AND WORKING!!!! Then i'd be like. Oh ya!  But $20 for changes I mostly can't see.... ehhhh... if it was $10 i'd be more favorable.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I have NWN EE edition and it crashes all the time.  I'm playing through Aielund right now and common crash points are transitioning to new areas, and funnily enough, saving the game!

The best advice I can give is to save often. Not just quicksave, but vanilla save as well. 

I think beamdog is asking for the crash reports to be sent to them but I actually dont know how much effort they can afford to put into bug fixes, particularly with the huge variety of custom mods out there, I can imagine it would be an absolute nightmare with minimal reward for them, and it would be far more attractive to them to invest into new projects to allow them to continue to employ staff. Perhaps they could build their own NWN expansion pack and sell that to us to help pay for the bug fixes?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Well, the problem with Beamdog is that they haven't done anything in particular so far...
We wait, and wait, and wait...But no expansions, no new stories, no real fixes to many problems we have had since the early days of Neverwinter Nights and still persist.
I wouldn't call the 1.70 community patch an official fix to all of that either.
Their boards have hundreds if not thousands of requests, how do you think they are going to do them all (if any)?
So far, only thing that I have seen is server support (which is good), some filtering over the original blocky & blurry textures & a single Aribeth model. That's it.
Anyway, let's be optimistic here & wait some more.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
It's hard to compare it to something like Dota 2, which is a free online game run by Valve. It gets constant bug fixes (like a patch every week minimum, possibly multiple every week) and new additions to game play. Sometimes it is patched so much, the patches cause problems and have to be 'repatched! 

The financial aspect is Dota is supported by community donations (in exchange for cosmetic items in game). The big fundraiser is a tournament called 'The International' which the community essentially donates money towards the prizepool for the players . Only 25% of donations are contributed towards this prize pool. The prize pool this year is nearly $25 million USD, and they are only halfway through the donation phase (53 days out of 110 - http://dota2.prizetrac.kr/international2019). So Valve has raised about $100 million USD in approximately 50 days, and there is still time left for this get even higher. The issue here is Valve has so much income from their fundraising, are they doing enough with it? (The running joke for the players 'game is still in beta', 'Valve is still indie company with only 5 staff')

I think NWN in comparison, even with a very loyal fanbase, has a very limited income stream for Beamdog, which seems to be the EE edition purchases and DLC? Like I got the EE edition on a Steam Sale. I cant remember how much exactly I paid for it, but it was probably less than $5 USD.

posts.author: MrZork
posts.content:
To be fair, Beamdog has fixed a decent number of bugs and has added some nice features over 1.69, though some of it has been behind the scenes. As an example, those who play WoG may have noticed a couple of "item design consultants" (or similar) in the customization areas. Not a major thing, of course, but that wouldn't even be possible without extensions to the scripting system in EE.

Of course, new releases have slowed tremendously and there are still lots of bugs to be addressed. That's disappointing to me. I can understand that Beamdog might want to hold off on some releases until bigger features are ready, such as the key holing in graphics and game playability across newer playforms. But, my preference would be to keep plugging away at actual bugs instead of trying to make NWN playable on people's phones. I couldn't care less about the latter. Well, of course I could, but we are at the point where very sensitive equipment is needed to detect any concern. ;-)

And, to be honest, I really prefer more bug fixes and "opening" hard-coded features (e.g. how many feats, skills, and combat mechanics work) to scripting over new modules and so on. I know that that sort of content is popular. But, the community has made great content and will make more, particularly as more becomes doable with the game. What is harder for the community to do is fix engine bugs and deal with hard-coded features.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I won't say much, but what Beamdog is doing Zork, can be done with just a coder & nothing else. 
That's not what I expect from a "company", this is what I would expect from a friend doing in his free time.
Even the filters over the graphics, all of these things already existed on NwN.
Like you, I want to see some real impovements to the game, especially the gameplay section.

Fix those useless feats like dirty fighting, the problematic skills like parry, the "unarmed strike" so that is able to take all the feats appropriately, the moronic companion A.I. in the default campaigns, the overly nerfed holy avenger, etc. I could talk for hours...Instead we got some unwanted "fixes" to death attack & stunning fist. Alright, an improvement also to the circle kick. They basically, made Assassin useless, who told them to do that? As if death attack was the OP ability & not Dev. Critical. 

They do stuff for the phones because from there they will get money & that's not the problem as long as they delivered what they promised for the actual game too.
Enhanced Edition, they said. Alright, where is it?

I don't want to pursue this further & I want for them to succeed, but man, all I hear is promises.

Like you mentioned so quickly so many balance issues regarding Dirty Fighting (useless ability), Parry (useless ability), Assassin nerf, Devastating Critical being overpowered (like cmon, DC 40-50 fortitude save or die? it should totally be DC 20-30 to be balanced)

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Orion2019 wrote: Maybe we can start a list of things we would liked changed and post it in the NWN reddit forum. See how much support we get? JuliusBorisov, who seems to run a lot of the community engagement for BeamDog, and respond to criticism posted in those forums only a few days ago, so maybe they will see.

Like you mentioned so quickly so many balance issues regarding Dirty Fighting (useless ability), Parry (useless ability), Assassin nerf, Devastating Critical being overpowered (like cmon, DC 40-50 fortitude save or die? it should totally be DC 20-30 to be balanced)

I can add Weapon focus: unarmed/Epic Weapon focus: unarmed/Weapon Specialisation: Unarmed/Epic Weapon Specialisation: Unarmed not working for polymorphs properly

Spellcasting with Improved expertise feat is that broken too?
Hate to disagree, but I really don't think compiling a list of "wants" and "don't wants" on behalf of the Guild is a starter - nothing to stop you posting what you'd like, of course - but the problem is getting concensus. For example, I disagree with what you say about Dev Crit and Parry (which is not useless, just very poorly implemented). And I'd like to see Initiative addressed properly, while we're at it, which I'm sure matters not one whit to many members. Then there's the issue of party control, and so on and so forth. Who gets to decide what's included in our putative list and what isn't? It can't include every gripe and whinge or we'd be here until eternity gets bored of us hanging around.

Equally, I know Grizzled Dwarflord has attempted to address the DA gimping and Lilura has also raised many issues with Beam Dog, all to no avail. The cynic in me has to conclude that while it's all very well having someone take criticism on board, it's a whole different thing having them actually act upon it. One of my suspicions is that they weren't quite prepared for the extent to which the NwN communities have grown, and so weren't fully cognisant of the extent of the task they were undertaking in the first place, or indeed the varying priorities of those different communities.

I do, however, agree with Valerfor that the lag between announcement and meaningful action is woeful. However, I'll bide my time.

(Gods, I hate sobriety )

Cheers

posts.author: gkorjax
posts.content:
I think addressing gripes and talking about it is important, even here, where it is not exactly on topic here with the forum title, because we need to keep these issues upfront and current. Otherwise this company is making money on a lot of promises, and fixing "issues" that no one cared about. I mean that assassin "fix" came out of nowhere.

I used to check out the beamdog NWN:EE forums all the time to see what was happening...that as nothing really happened, I've forgotten about it. And I play NWN practically every day. I'd love to see that keyholing come into play. I thought it was right around the corner, and that was like months ago!

If not us, then who?

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Oh, please don't get me wrong gkorjax, I have no problem at all with the discussion - and you're right, issues do need to be raised and talked about. My problem is about the practicalities of a coordinated Guild response. And I certainly wouldn't advocate a "loudest voice gets their way" method of taking things forward. If you have a proposal, I for one would be happy to hear it. But as, predominantly, a Builders' Guild, we don't get to choose the materials with which we work, just how we best use what's at our disposal, and that's always been the way, regardless of which game we espouse. And, of course, we don't have to purchase EE - maybe letting it flounder without financial support until they actually do something has its merits? A sort of Gandhi salt march, if you will.

And if nothing else, talking lets us vent our various spleens, which can't be a bad thing.

(Right - now I am going to have a drink...)

Cheers

Just an update from my reddit thread.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: The Trello board has been going since the inception of EE some 18 months ago. Its essential problem is that it's quantative rather than qualitative in its approach, so an awful lot of good suggestions fall through the cracks. And there's no commitment from Beam Dog to implement anything at all as a result.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Again the cynic in me rears its head. It's so much easier to ignore everything and implement nothing when there is no driving will behind change - always being able to cite contrary views in your defence. "If we implement x, y will be upset, so we won't do that. And if we implement y, z will hate it," etc, etc. It all simply faux-legitimizes doing whatever you wanted in the first place, and nothing that anyone else wants. And that's the will of the "market" in a nutshell. I'll shut up now, as I'm verging on the political.

Cheers

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
Orion2019 wrote:  Devastating Critical being overpowered (like cmon, DC 40-50 fortitude save or die? it should totally be DC 20-30 to be balanced)
Totally agree on that call. I've never played a character using devastating critical mainly because of the OP issue but decided I would give it a try in my playthrough of Swordflight (because it's so fricken difficult). I built the character in my Arena Store and Bar module through to level 40 and gave him a run through against all difficulty levels. Dual wielding keen scimitars, he one or two shotted everything that wasn't immune to crits including ancient dragons. In fact, I spammed a bunch of ancient dragons in and he just carved them up in about 10 seconds. The only buffs were Bull's, Cat's and clarity. No other build I've ever put through the arena has even come close. I had heard it was overpowered but I didn't realise to what extent this was true.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Try my half-orc with 56 DC, then tell me about it...

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Sorry, but I don't agree. Dev Crit may well be a highly-powered feat (if you have a decent DC), but do we really want to say that it's ok for arcanists to insta-kill folk but we don't want to have meleers able to do the same? Talk about lack of balance...

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
I see your point Stag and while I was mulling it over I rummaged through the interweb to find a belt of immunity to critical hits and a spell scroll of immunity to critical hits but I couldn't find them anywhere. I think it's a cool feat but would be better with a lower DC inline with death magic saves.

edit: Just looking at Valerfor's post above, in order to make a successful save you'd need a minimum constitution modifier of 36 to not die 95% of the time. So the fact that the DC for Dev Crit is 10 + 1/2 character level + STR modifier makes saves much more difficult than d20 + INT or CHA modifier. I think...

Sent from my G3125 using Tapatalk

Sent from my G3125 using Tapatalk
Oh, I'm not saying it's perfect - what is? But most (or at least many) module and PW creators give crit immunity to bosses - much as they give them True Seeing and various other immunities. And you have to burn at least 3 otherwise pretty useless feats to get Dev Crit (what use Power Attack, Great Cleave and Overwhelming Critical in a strength-based build?), as well as hitting strength of at least 25 - thereby in all likelihood knackering your AC and will saves (unless you build carefully, of course ). That's quite an investment!

On the other end of the spectrum, is Epic Dodge also OP? Is HiPS? And don't even get me started on clerics' Harm or ba-bas' Terrifying Rage. Sorry, I just react badly to anti-grunt stuff - someone has to stand tall for us knuckle-runners!

Go well - cheers

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Stagmeister wrote: Sorry, but I don't agree. Dev Crit may well be a highly-powered feat (if you have a decent DC), but do we really want to say that it's ok for arcanists to insta-kill folk but we don't want to have meleers able to do the same? Talk about lack of balance...
Stag knows I've opened a can of worms here...  or dug my self a big hole... sinking fast.... apologies...

In all seriousness Stag has some valid points. He has made significant efforts to explain it to me since I posted my comment which I sincerely appreciate. Its basically around casters and their ability to instant death enemies.

For example I've been having a great time as a druid spamming Finger of Deaths, Slay Living, Harm spells. Sorcerers and Wizards can drink a Potion of Speed, cast Time Stop, Mord's to remove death magic immunity, lower their enemies levels and saves, then kill whoever they want. I haven't even started playing Clerics seriously, and they have Implosion (area of effect instant death which bypasses death magic immunity AND +3 spell DC). 

So yes Dev Crit is super strong like really strong. Some of the other spells are also super strong too. 

It takes a large amount of investment simply to have access to Devastating Critical. Strength 25+, and five feats (cleave, great cleave, improved critical, overwhelming critical and power attack). On top of that, the player will want to increase the critical chance (improving the range from a 10% chance to a 55% chance with scimitar/rapier/kukri weapon master ki critical and keen weapon) and succeed with a fortitude save (from sky high AB). Weapon master requirements include 6 feats (dodge, expertise, mobility, spring attack, weapon focus, whirlwind) plus 4 ranks of intimidate. So we are talking about taking a lot of feats and lots of investment for a very powerful ability.

Compare that with a high Wisdom (say 36 unbuffed, 48 wisdom buffed) cleric with SF/GSF/ESF evocation running around with a potion of speed and invisibility. He sneaks up to a group he wants to kill, casts two implosion spells. AOE DC Fort save or death of 19+3+6+10+9 = 47. No death immunity. Two casts with the haste from the potion of speed. His investment is much lower than the fighter in this situation and he gets an area of effect instant death spell with a high Fort save required that bypasses death immunity. 

So Dev Crit I am no longer sure about. It's certainly a very strong ability. Whether it should be nerfed or not ... ? not sure. 

Maybe buff rogues or assassin or rangers. Give them an instant death skill too :)

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I suspect we may have crossed in the post here, Orion - is that a double-ninja? Thanks, regardless!

As far as the 3 other classes you mention are concerned: EE has gimped Assassin's Death Attack for no good reason I can see (if they were going to do anything with the class, my personal view is that it should be opened to Neutral characters as well as Evil, but that's a long-standing grumble of mine). For Rangers, given that the class has already been somewhat neutered in D&D 3, it certainly wouldn't hurt to ramp up Bane of Enemies. And Rogues can blow anyone up with traps already - and fearsome potential levels of sneak attack, so they're already catered for - let alone ED.

Sorry, you've caught me in rant mode

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Beamdog has released a development update with a whole bunch of changes to the game's core engine to NWN EE

No balance changes. Please note the following:
This patch introduces backwards-breaking changes to save games and character files (specifically, the Red Dragon Disciple). Please read the patch notes carefully and make backups of your saves and characters.
https://steamcommunity.com/games/704450 ... 3011879979

posts.author: Shia_Luck
posts.content:
Orion2019 wrote: ↑
Aug 07, 2019
Beamdog has released a development update with a whole bunch of changes to the game's core engine to NWN EE

No balance changes. Please note the following:
This patch introduces backwards-breaking changes to save games and character files (specifically, the Red Dragon Disciple). Please read the patch notes carefully and make backups of your saves and characters.
https://steamcommunity.com/games/704450 ... 3011879979 
Hi all, long time, no see... as usual. *Blushing*

Just been checking into this.

Current state:
Existing RDDs who used the RDD lvl 10 +2CHA to qualify for spells have lost access to those spell levels/two highest spell levels. This is definitely true if e.g. your Bard/RDD has CHA16 @ lvl40, AKA you have only the minimum CHA required for spells.  I have not tested with a RDD who has higher than the min CHA required.
If you check your character sheet you will have the correct CHA, but while levelling the RDD CHA is not counted.
Therefore, new RDDs cannot at this moment use the lvl10 CHA to qualify for spells either.

What Beamdog say:
"...there's a few issues with how it was implemented, which will be addressed. The intended behavior is to remain exactly as it was previously, just allow builders to tweak it per-module, or to add it to more classes."
https://forums.beamdog.com/discussion/7 ... pms#latest

So, a fix is coming.
Have fun :)

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
You'll always be welcome back here, Shia, even if you are an habitual runaway !

Cheers

posts.author: Shia_Luck
posts.content:
Hi Stag :)  You are too kind. :)


EDIT: Unfortunately it is PM as well.  This one we can fix ourselves tho. They made these changes so the various feats/bonuses etc are no longer hardcoded and can be edited via .2da files. So we can in this case edit that 2da ourselves.

Your install path probably looks like this C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Neverwinter Nights\ovr . If not, you need to find wherever you put the steam version of NWN:EE and specifically the ovr folder.  Inside that is cls_stat_palema.2da which can be opened with notepad/wordpad etc.

Look at that file and you see the AC bonuses are given one level later than they should be. All you need to do is move that "2" in the NaturalAC column one line higher and replace any blanks with **** .

It's a known issue for Beamdog so it will get fixed but until then this temporary one will work.

Have fun :)

posts.author: Shia_Luck
posts.content:
OK, it's fixed :)  Unexpectedly quick work by BD there.

But, you need to opt into betas (In Steam, R click on NWN >> properties >> betas) and choose dev build 8193.1 . This is compatible with the stable build so you will still be able to play on PWs that have patched to only the stable build. 
https://steamcommunity.com/games/704450 ... 9639717609

Have fun :)

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content: Just thought I'd mention my recent EE experience through GOG. A couple of weeks ago the game apparently updated and then wouldn't launch. Dr Cat from GOG was helpful and gave me a whole rigamarole of procedures to go through to solve the problem which worked. A couple of cosmetic changes were immediately evident upon launching. The main menu screen has changed and now when my PC is behind/under something which impedes the view of the PC, a hole appears in the obstacle as per the screenshot. I'm not sure whether I like this or not. It is kind of helpful when running under bridges battlements etc.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi Eltalstro

I have NWN: EE through Steam.

I do like the keyholing feature, but it does take getting used to.

You can turn it off, I understand through the graphics options in the main menu.

You can also modify the keyholing feature's size and other variables. There are limits to what it can do. 

I was taught this in the WoG forum by BlackCobra and WebShaman.

Press: Ctrl-Shift-F12.

It loads a menu.

Click on config at the top of the screen.

Then scroll down to keyholing. I've attached the location in the screenshot it is marked by the red arrow.



You can then scroll up to the top, confirm changes, then press Ctrl-Shift-F12 to close the menu.

I had no problems updating, however there is a problem with custom portraits during character creature if you have too many like 2000+ (which I had before updating), I've managed this by reducing the number of portraits loaded..

Hope this is of value to you.

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
Thanks, Orion!

Sent from my G3125 using Tapatalk

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
All very useful info, everyone - particularly (and selfishly) as I'm probably going to have to get the EE version soon. My poor old coal-powered version is crashing on a far too regular basis for me to sustain it much longer - and purchasing EE is probably cheaper than replacing broken monitors and/or keyboards from frustration on a quarterly basis.

Cheers

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
In terms of NWN stability, something that might be helpful to know, is NWN 1 seems to use up a massive amount of RAM like a few GB or something. 

In addition my browser (ie chrome or something) seems to do the same. It's using half a gigabyte right now of RAM when I open windows task manager, and all I've got is Tapatalk and NWN Wiki open. 

Running Microsoft Windows, I notice that I have to restart the computer after a period of time for whatever reason, (possibly inefficent code or something) if I find my performance drops. This seems to be more on my laptop than my desktop computer which is faster.

We had a discussion in the WoG forum about trying to improve the NWN performance on our computers and current server and my understand was performance might be helped by:
- closing other programs like web browsers
- consider memory upgrades if this is an issue
- consider Linux because its more stable than MS Windows

Maybe Web or one of the other WoG players can correct me / add to this if I've missed anything here.

Upgrading to the EE probably makes sense in terms of stability, like they have released a bunch of patches presumably looking at improving the code of the software but I'm honestly unsure how much bang for your buck you will get if some of the other stuff hasn't be utilised.

Oh and trialling NWN on Linux is something on my to-do list. I haven't done it yet, but it doesn't seem that hard. I believe Steam allows NWN to run on it, which is good. Presumably GoG will allow you to do the same.

Addit: if you get the EE feel free to join myself, Grom, Web, Gkorjax, Ratty_Uk/Hoeder and others on WoG. It's a party server, solo is tough but doable (particularly with a bit of patience), Mick and Empyre are welcome too. It's all good fun. 

By the way I had a total party kill (two of us, we were level 15) last night against a whirlwind attack using boss who did 120-150 damage on a critical hit! Normally we just ignore whirlwind attacks on our builds heh :).  I bet he was a weapon master too, he did critical hits often! I won't say where he is though to avoid spoilers, but even though we were all wiped out, I just had to marvel at the ingenuity of the person who designed the area. It was like.... 'Surprise!!!!' In addition we had improved invisibility and stoneskin up (from UMD)! In addition there was another boss who also nearly wiped us out from crippling strike. I was suddenly like - where's my strength? I'm encumbered!! Good times! I am very enlightened by that experience.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: A CD gives a more accurate reproduction of the original sound.  Vinyl adds warmth that is not supposed to be there, even though that does make it sound "better".
